modules.description: Provides functions to manage logging channels, including refreshing a channel, generating debug outputs, and capturing snapshots of log state. Operates with channel handles, time tags, and log configuration parameters. Used to control log verbosity, generate table of contents entries, and reset logging state to a previous snapshot.

Provides functions to manage logging channels, refresh output, capture snapshots, and control log formatting. Works with out_channel, string, int, and custom types like time_tagged and location_format. Used to generate structured logs, track elapsed time, and manage table of contents entries in real-time debugging scenarios.

Provides functions to instrument code with debug logging, capturing control flow, values, and execution traces in structured formats. Works with lexical scopes, function calls, and bindings, supporting customizable logging levels and output formatting. Enables detailed analysis of program behavior, including comparison of execution runs and navigation through large log files.

Provides functions to open and close log entries with source code positions, log values in various formats (Sexp, pretty-printed, or as strings), and manage log output with options for highlighting, pruning, and snapshotting. Operates on Sexp.t, Format.formatter, and custom log entry identifiers. Used to instrument code for detailed runtime tracing, compare execution runs, and generate structured logs for debugging or analysis.
